revised_title: High Temperature Standards and Comparison of Thermometers
tldr: This article discusses a comparison of platinum thermometers and thermo-junctions with a gas thermometer to establish high temperature standards at the National Physical Laboratory. The results confirm the use of Callendar's difference formula for reducing platinum thermometer readings to the normal scale. The study extends the comparison to a temperature of 1000°C and includes a table for calculating the value of T directly from the value of Pt.
